g.text: CIRCUIT BREAKER MUST BE OFF FOR STEPS C-01 THROUGH C-05.
This device cannot detect 240V wiring errors. These visual checks are the only defense against branch circuit faults.
Inspect: conductor gauge, breaker rating, junction box connections, EGC continuity.
PASS: Conductors match breaker rating per NEC 240.4(D). EGC continuous from panel to both loads.
Inspect: clamp on correct conductor (EV charger leg, not AC leg). Arrow on clamp points toward load.
PASS: Clamp on EV charger conductor, correct orientation (arrow toward load). See wiring diagram on reverse.
Inspect: Y, C, and G wires on correct SideCharge terminals. No shorts between thermostat conductors.
PASS: Y (cool call), C (common/24VAC), G (fan) on correct terminals per wiring diagram on reverse.
Inspect: pilot signal wire connected to correct terminal on EVSE side.
PASS: Pilot wire connected to SideCharge pilot input terminal. See wiring diagram on reverse.
Inspect: device secured to wall or junction box. Conduit entries sealed. No strain on low-voltage wires.
PASS: Device firmly mounted. All conduit entries sealed. No wire strain.
Turn ON circuit breaker. Observe LEDs.
Action: Apply power (close breaker). Observe green LED 1Hz flash within 5 seconds.
Then press Charge Now button 5 times within 3 seconds. Count LED blink codes.
PASS: Green LED 1Hz flash within 5s. After 5-press: green blinks only, zero red blinks.
If both LEDs rapid-flash (5Hz): self-test failed. Any red blinks: hardware check failed. Do not proceed.
Action: Wait for LED transition. Allow up to 5 minutes.
PASS: Green LED transitions from 1Hz flash to solid (typically 30-90 seconds).
If still flashing after 5 min, verify Sidewalk gateway is within range.
Action: Set thermostat to call for cooling.
PASS: Blue LED transitions to heartbeat pulse (200ms on, 1800ms off).
Action: Cancel cooling call at thermostat.
PASS: Blue LED returns to off (idle). Confirms device sees signal drop.
Action: Plug in EV, or start a charge session.
PASS: Blue LED goes solid. Current reading >0 in uplink (if cloud-verified).
Action: Trigger AC call (set thermostat to cool) WHILE the EV is charging.
PASS: Blue LED transitions to heartbeat pulse. EV charger pauses (pilot drops to State B).
If EV does NOT pause: STOP. Do not leave the job site.
Investigate charge enable wiring and J1772 pilot connection.
Action: Cancel AC call while EV is still connected.
PASS: Blue LED returns to solid. EV charger resumes (pilot returns to State C).
This card is the installation record. Attach to device enclosure or junction box cover.
Green LED = Health / Connectivity. Blue LED = Interlock / Charging.
Hardware fault. Power-cycle the device. If rapid flash returns within 60s, check: thermostat wires,
current clamp, J1772 pilot. Contact support if persistent.
Not connecting to Sidewalk. Check: (a) Amazon Sidewalk gateway (Echo/Ring) within range,
(b) device is registered in AWS IoT Wireless, (c) MFG credentials are valid.
Interlock is holding EV paused even though AC is off. Check: thermostat Y wire for short to C,
or stale AC call flag. Power-cycle to clear. If recurring, thermostat wiring issue.
Current clamp may be on wrong conductor or reversed. Re-check C-02 (current clamp placement).
If clamp is correct but still zero, check clamp model compatibility and ADC calibration.
This card is your installation record.
Complete all 12 steps. Leave this card at the job site.
